channel.title: Stream Ciphering
channel.description:
So this is my last attempt at getting help from this community, please don't let me down...
Okay so the current method of ISAAC ciphering in 317 private servers is messy to be honest. I would prefer not to implement it into my framework if I don't have to.
So what I wanted to know is can Java's SecureRandom from the java.security package be used instead. I know Rsdaemon has an implementation of SecureRandom working with the ugly ISAAC cipher generation class, but I want to use SecureRandom as a stand alone implementation.
I thought perhaps you could create a new instance of the SecureRandom, set the algorithm to ISAAC and generate a seed in which to make a server key.
Would this work? Are there any other ways of doing? All help is extremely appreciated.

item.title: Stream Ciphering
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

So this is my last attempt at getting help from this community, please don’t let me down…

Okay so the current method of ISAAC ciphering in 317 private servers is messy to be honest. I would prefer not to implement it into my framework if I don’t have to.

So what I wanted to know is can Java’s SecureRandom from the java.security package be used instead. I know Rsdaemon has an implementation of SecureRandom working with the ugly ISAAC cipher generation class, but I want to use SecureRandom as a stand alone implementation.

I thought perhaps you could create a new instance of the SecureRandom, set the algorithm to ISAAC and generate a seed in which to make a server key.

Would this work? Are there any other ways of doing? All help is extremely appreciated.
